sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews Now. I'm Tecumseh Salako with your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: First group of civilians trapped for weeks inside a steel plant in Mariupol are heading to a Ukrainian-controlled city as attempts continue to let others leave their shelters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: EU energy ministers are seeking to achieve a meeting of minds over how to handle Russia's threats to cut off gas and oil supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And EU leaders will be looking for India's support as its Prime Minister Narendra Modi begins a three-day tour of the bloc.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There's been sporadic shelling by Russian forces of the war-torn city Mariupol's besieged steel plant following a partial evacuation of civilians, that's according to Ukrainian

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: sources.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On Sunday, the Russian Defense Ministry released footage of what it said was the evacuation of civilians from the Azovstal steel complex in the centre of the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Other footage released by Ukrainian Azov forces showed some of the 100 people being helped to leave their underground shelters before being bussed out of the area to both Russian-controlled and Ukraine-controlled territory after weeks of being under siege.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The children had been asking for food all the time, said one woman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The adults had endured the hunger better.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Azov military came to our bunker and said that they were searching our apartments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They shouted, claiming that most of the city was pro-Russian.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They told us they had entered lots of apartments and had seen the Russian flag on display in almost all of them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: To be honest, I don't have a Russian flag in my apartment, or a Ukrainian one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: President Zelensky thanked the UN and the Red Cross for helping organize the evacuation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Today we finally managed to start the evacuation of people from Azovstal. After many weeks of negotiations, after many attempts, different meetings with different people, calls, countries, proposals, finally, there was not a single day when we were not trying to find a solution to save our people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As many as 100,000 people are still believed to be blockaded in Mariupol, including up to 1,000 civilians who are hunkered down with an estimated 2,000 Ukrainian fighters beneath the Soviet-era steel plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Moscow is preparing for national celebrations on the 9th of May, marking the country's World War II victory over Nazi Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As Euronews correspondent Galina Polonskaya reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Russian military will not artificially adjust their deadline in Ukraine to the 9th of May, Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov has said in an interview to the Italian TV broadcaster Mediaset. The rehearsals for the highly symbolic 9th of May military parade on Red Square have already taken place in Moscow and this Sunday state media showed rallies dedicated to another national holiday, the 1st of May. There were images of people with Soviet flags and cars decorated with the letter Z incorporated in the letters of the traditional peace labor May slogan but there were also other posters and symbols on the streets. The OVD Info Police watchdog reported that more than 30 protesters were detained in various Russian cities on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: One of them, Anna Anisimova, chained herself in St. Petersburg in front of a TV set decorated with a photo of one of the top pro-Kremlin TV anchors and the letter Z written on it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Galina Polonskaya, Euronews from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: European Union energy ministers are meeting today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The first such gathering since Russia's decision to cut gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The aim is to remain united and to show solidarity within the bloc as they seek ways to deal with Russia's move.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Energy giant Gazprom halted gas supplies last week over Poland and Bulgaria's refusal to pay in rubles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Kremlin wants payment in the Russian currency to lessen the impact of Western sanctions that include hundreds of billions of dollars of Russian assets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The EU has accused Moscow of blackmail, but is considering ways for payments to be made without breaching current embargoes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, Vladimir Putin's actions have pushed Europe to the brink of an energy crisis, prompting a 20% increase in the price of gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Germany is Gazprom's most important customer, importing 55% of its gas from Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Berlin has paid the energy giant 5 billion euros for gas and oil since the beginning of the conflict in Ukraine. Italy, Finland, Croatia and Latvia are also heavily reliant on Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi kicks off a three-day tour of Europe today, where he'll

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: be holding bilateral talks to Germany, Denmark and France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Following European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen's visit to Delhi last week, Modi is looking to negotiate a free trade deal with Brussels and strengthen ties with the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But his trip comes at a sensitive time, with India and the EU split on their response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Our reporter Jonah Kalgren has more from Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will of course get the high-level red carpet treatment during his visit to Berlin. There will be military honors and certainly a meeting with the German Chancellor Olaf Scholz. But there are disagreements between these two countries, especially when it comes to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: India has refused to join the sanctions against Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And India has announced that it will continue to buy Russian oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And that might undercut expected sanctions that the EU is expected to announce in the coming days targeting Russian oil. However, it's unclear if Olaf Scholz, someone who has himself been criticized heavily for not supporting the Ukrainians enough, will be able to change Modi's mind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Jonah Kalgrin, Euronews, Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: mind. Jonna Kellgren, Euronews, Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: British Member of Parliament Neil Parrish is facing an inquiry after resigning for watching pornographic videos while in the House of Commons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The information about his activities emerged after female members of the Conservative 2022 group met in Westminster last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Women in Parliament are increasingly coming forward to decry what they are calling a shameful culture at the heart of British democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The UK's Conservative Party has been dogged by controversy of late.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There have been calls for Prime Minister Boris Johnson to stand down after he was found guilty of breaking lockdown rules at the height of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The opposition's deputy leader, Angela Rayner, has also asked for answers from Johnson after rumours arose that a Sexist of the Year award was handed out at a lockdown-breaking party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Last week, Rayner was also targeted by misogynistic claims allegedly made by a Tory MP.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The recent scandals are expected to have an impact in local elections later this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: New Zealand has welcomed nationals from over 50 countries for the first time in two years as it drops almost all of its remaining pandemic border restrictions. However, tourists still need to be vaccinated and test themselves for the virus after arriving.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The move has been welcomed by many New Zealanders and it is expected to give a boost to the tourism sector that accounted for 20% of New Zealand's foreign income before Covid-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In France, the number of new Covid cases dropped by 30% last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This decrease also extends to new hospitalizations and patients in critical condition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Paris is now seeing a rise in tourism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There are 20% more foreign visitors than spring 2019.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And tourists are happy to be back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I couldn't come because of the restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Now it's finally opening back and it's amazing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And in China, the zero COVID policy put a stop to the popular May the 1st holiday travel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: All of Beijing's restaurants were closed to dine-in customers and tourist attractions were limited to half capacity over the weekend. A temporary hospital in the capital has also been reopened as the country tries to curb the latest Covid-19 outbreak. TIME FOR US TO TAKE A BREAK HERE ON THE PROGRAM, BUT WE'LL BE BACK IN A FEW MINUTES.
